Sentencas: The volatility of borate species from glasses developed for solid oxide fuel cell seals was studied using thermodynamic calculations and compared with experimental results.
Titulo: Borate volatility from SOFC sealing glasses

Sentencas: Vapor pressure diagrams were used to identify the most volatile compounds under a range of expected operational conditions, e.g. oxidizing and reducing atmospheres with water vapor, at temperatures in the range of 700 degrees-1000 degrees C.
Titulo: Borate volatility from SOFC sealing glasses

Sentencas: The species with the highest vapor pressures were BO2(g) under dry conditions and B3H3O6(g) under wet, reducing conditions.
Titulo: Borate volatility from SOFC sealing glasses

Sentencas: The depletion of boron from glass surfaces to depths beyond 100 nm was characterized using Auger electron spectroscopy depth profile analysis.
Titulo: Borate volatility from SOFC sealing glasses

Sentencas: Weight loss experiments were conducted on several different glass compositions.
Titulo: Borate volatility from SOFC sealing glasses

Sentencas: The cumulative weight loss from a glass with 20 mol% B2O3 (glass #59) was about 10 times greater than from a glass with 2 mol% B2O3 (glass #27), under the same conditions.
Titulo: Borate volatility from SOFC sealing glasses

Sentencas: The activation energy for volatilization from glass #59 was 371 +/- 86 kJ/mol and was 272 +/- 65 kJ/mol for glass #27.
Titulo: Borate volatility from SOFC sealing glasses

Sentencas: The cumulative weight loss of each composition in forming gas with 30% water vapor was greater than in dry air at 800 degrees C. Volatile species were collected in a water trap, and these results confirmed predictions about the effect of atmosphere and B2O3 content on volatilization behavior.
Titulo: Borate volatility from SOFC sealing glasses
